Class SolveMaze

  • java.lang.Object
    • SolveMaze

  • public class SolveMaze
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    SDK 1.8 Holds all methods relating to the solving of a 2D character maze
    Author:
    Marc Shepherd

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean atStart 
      private boolean finished 
      private boolean solved 
      private int STARTING_COL
      STARTING_ROW, STARTING_COL -- allows for setting of boolean variable atStart to check if at starting indice atStart -- true if at start, false otherwise solved -- true if solved, false otherwise; part of base condition finished -- true if finished, false otherwise; part of base condition
      private int STARTING_ROW
      STARTING_ROW, STARTING_COL -- allows for setting of boolean variable atStart to check if at starting indice atStart -- true if at start, false otherwise solved -- true if solved, false otherwise; part of base condition finished -- true if finished, false otherwise; part of base condition

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SolveMaze(int row, int col)
      Sets initial atStart to true, solved to false, and finished to false

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int chooseColumn()
      prompts user for column selection in maze
      static int chooseRow()
      prompts user for row selection in maze
      boolean mazeTraversal(char[][] maze, int row, int col)
      Maneuvers through maze, putting an x for traversed paths and replaces current location with '@' at each step if the path results in a dead end.
      private static void printMaze(char[][] maze)
      Prints out maze
      static void printMazeforStartMenu(char[][] maze)
      Prints the maze with row and column numbers for easy user input -- only prints on the start menu

    • Method Detail

      • mazeTraversal

        public boolean mazeTraversal(char[][] maze,
                             int row,
                             int col)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Maneuvers through maze, putting an x for traversed paths and replaces current location with '@' at each step if the path results in a dead end.
        Parameters:
        maze - -- brings in specified maze in main method
        row - -- current row in path -- changes based on current recursive step
        col - -- current col in path -- changes based on current recursive step
        Returns:
        boolean -- true if maze solved, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - -- simulated maze completion time for visibility -- remove TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.sleep if unwanted

      • chooseRow

        public static int chooseRow()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        prompts user for row selection in maze
        Returns:
        row -- subtracts one to use for indice
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - incase of illegal input

      • chooseColumn

        public static int chooseColumn()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        prompts user for column selection in maze
        Returns:
        column -- subtracts one to use for indice
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - incase of illegal input attempt

      • printMaze

        private static void printMaze(char[][] maze)
        Prints out maze
        Parameters:
        maze - -- brings in the maze from main method

      • printMazeforStartMenu

        public static void printMazeforStartMenu(char[][] maze)
        Prints the maze with row and column numbers for easy user input -- only prints on the start menu
        Parameters:
        maze - -- brings in the maze from main method
